item.title: My way of doing pomodoros
item.description: If you haven’t heard about The Pomodoro Technique and know some Italian. In that case, you may wonder: “Is this a cooking blog?”. But no, I will not talk about the tasty tomatoes (Pomodoro in Italian) today. I will speak of a time management method created by Francesco Cirillo that consists of having deep focus sessions of approximately 25 minutes and a break of 5 minutes. Also, every 4 sessions, a more extended break of 15 minutes.

item.title: How to set up a Free Todoist account with GTD
item.description: Introduction First of all, I want to be clear that this is not a paid post about Todoist or David Allen Company. I decided to write this post because I’m a GTD (Getting Things Done) aficionado, and I happen to use Todoist as the tool for my GTD system. The idea of this post is to explain how to do an initial set-up for GTD in a Todoist free account.

item.title: Using Sealed Secrets to encrypt secrets in a Helm Chart values file
item.description: Reading the title of this post you may ask yourself: “Why would I want to encrypt a secret and put it on a values file?”. And to that, I would respond: “Well, to push it to GitHub (or any equivalent), of course”.
